urls.description: This report examines why victims do not report bias-motivated incidents and the barriers that they face when reporting incidents through national crime reporting systems. By mapping existing practices that have a bearing on the victim‚Äôs experiences when reporting bias-motivated violence and harassment, it aims to provide evidence to support national efforts to encourage and facilitate reporting ‚Äì and ultimately assist Member States in delivering on their duties with regard to combating hate crime. urls.title: Step up rights protection of exploited migrant workers
urls.description: ricardo ¬© adobestock.com, 2021 Irregular migrants can fall victim to exploitative employers. The EU has rules to protect migrant workers in an irregular situation from exploitation and abuse, but gaps remain in their enforcement, finds a new report by the EU Agency for Fundamental Rights (FRA). Workers do not know their rights or how to complain, and even when they do, they may not receive compensation due. EU countries should do better to protect migrant workers‚Äô rights under existing EU rules. ‚ÄúAll
